facts.text: The Portland Timbers joined Major League Soccer (MLS) as an expansion team in which year? Answer: 2011
Who is the majority owner of the Portland Timbers? Answer: Merritt Paulson
In what year did the Portland Timbers win their first MLS Cup? Answer: 2015
Which team did the Portland Timbers defeat to win the MLS is Back Tournament in 2020? Answer: Orlando City SC
The Portland Timbers have a long-standing rivalry with which two clubs for the Cascadia Cup? Answer: Seattle Sounders and Vancouver Whitecaps FC
In what year did the original soccer team named the Timbers compete in the North American Soccer League (NASL)? Answer: 1975
What was the major achievement of the original Portland Timbers in their inaugural NASL season? Answer: Runners-up in Soccer Bowl '75
Merritt Paulson led a group that bought the USL Timbers and which other team in May 2007? Answer: Portland Beavers
What was identified as the biggest issue for the city of Portland in obtaining an MLS club? Answer: The need for a new stadium
The Portland Timbers were announced as Major League Soccer's eighteenth team on March 20, 2009.
John Spencer was named the first head coach of the Portland Timbers on August 10, 2010.
The Timbers signed five players before the MLS Expansion Draft on November 24, 2010.
The Timbers' first MLS game was on March 19, 2011, against the Colorado Rapids.
Kenny Cooper scored the first goal in the Timbers' MLS era.
The Portland Timbers finished their first MLS season in 6th place in the Western Conference and 12th place overall.
John Spencer was fired as head coach of the Portland Timbers on July 9, 2012, after a 0–3 loss to Real Salt Lake.
The Timbers won the Cascadia Cup in MLS for the first time in 2012.
The Portland Timbers were knocked out of playoff contention in their last game of the season against Real Salt Lake, which lifted RSL into their place by one point.
Giovanni Savarese was fired as the coach of the Portland Timbers midway through the 2023 season following a 5–0 road loss to the Houston Dynamo.
Giovanni Savarese led the Portland Timbers to two MLS Cup finals in 2018 and 2021 and secured the MLS is Back Tournament title in 2020.
Phil Neville was hired as the coach of the Portland Timbers for the next season after Giovanni Savarese's dismissal.
The Portland Timbers started their 2024 season with a new shirt sponsor, DaBella, which was canceled on February 28 due to sexual harassment allegations against the company's owner.
Tillamook became the replacement shirt sponsor for the Portland Timbers after the cancellation of the sponsorship with DaBella.
The Portland Timbers and Thorns played a co-ed charity match, the Green is Gold Charity Match, raising around $100,000 for environmental nonprofits.
Evander, Jonathan Rodriguez, and Felipe Mora combined for 45 of the Portland Timbers' 65 total MLS goals in the 2024 season.
The Portland Timbers finished ninth in the Western Conference in the 2024 season, making a play-in game in the 2024 MLS Cup playoffs.
The Portland Timbers sold Evander to FC Cincinnati for $12 million using the new MLS intra-league transfer method in the 2024−25 offseason.
The Portland Timbers' MLS logo incorporates elements of the former USL design, including a circular shape, an axe, and three chevrons organized to resemble a pine tree.
The Portland Timbers' jerseys were sponsored by Alaska Airlines starting in September 2010, with the home jersey being a two-tone halved green shirt and the alternate jersey being red.
The expanded Providence Park reopened on July 1, 2019.
Providence Park's expansion made it the 4th-highest seating capacity soccer-specific stadium in MLS.
The Portland Timbers sold out every home game from their transition to MLS in 2011 until the pandemic of 2020–2021, a streak of 163 games.
The Timbers cap season-ticket sales at 15,300.
The Timbers Army was originally founded in 2001 as the Cascade Rangers.
The Timbers Army changed its name from Cascade Rangers to Timbers Army in 2002.
In 2019, the Timbers Army protested against MLS's ban on the Iron Front symbol, leading to MLS reversing the policy on September 24, 2019.
The Cascadia Cup was created in 2004 by supporters of the Portland Timbers, Seattle Sounders FC, and Vancouver Whitecaps FC.
Portland Timbers have won the Cascadia Cup six times: in 2009, 2010, 2012, 2017, 2022, and 2024.
Portland Timbers became the first team in Cascadia to win the MLS Cup in 2015.
Timber Joey officially became the Portland Timbers' mascot during an exhibition game against Juventus Primavera on June 14, 2008.
The Portland Timbers won their first MLS Cup in 2015.
The Portland Timbers were runners-up in the MLS Cup in both 2018 and 2021.
The Timbers won the Western Conference Championship in 2015, 2018, and 2021.
The Portland Timbers were Western Conference Regular Season Winners in 2013 and 2017.
The Portland Timbers won the MLS is Back Tournament in 2020.
The Portland Timbers received the MLS Fair Play Award in 2011.
The Portland Timbers' best result in the CONCACAF Champions League was reaching the Quarterfinals in 2021.
Diego Valeri was inducted into the Timbers Ring of Honor on July 15, 2023, becoming the first MLS-era player to receive this honor.
Timber Jim's number was retired by the Portland Timbers in a halftime ceremony on April 17, 2008, making him the only non-player to be inducted into the Timbers Ring of Honor.
From 2023, every Portland Timbers match became available to stream via MLS Season Pass on the Apple TV app.
Before 2023, Portland Timbers' regular-season games not televised by Major League Soccer's national television partners were broadcast by Root Sports Northwest.
The Portland Timbers were awarded the 18th franchise of Major League Soccer (MLS) on January 23, 2010.
John Spencer was selected to coach the MLS Portland Timbers team for the 2011 season.
The Portland Timbers selected 10 players in the 2010 MLS Expansion Draft on November 24, 2010.
The Portland Timbers acquired Rodney Wallace from DC United in exchange for Dax McCarty on November 24, 2010.
The Portland Timbers fired coach John Spencer on July 9, 2012, and GM Gavin Wilkinson was named interim head coach.
The Portland Timbers qualified for the 2014-15 CONCACAF Champions League after a USSF rule change was approved in 2013.
The Portland Timbers failed to advance to the 2014 MLS playoffs after their performance in the final weekend of the season.
Real Salt Lake traded veteran defender Nat Borchers to the Portland Timbers in exchange for allocation money, as announced on February 14, 2015.
The Portland Timbers added Ghanaian goalkeeper Adam Larsen Kwarasey to their roster, as announced on February 14, 2015.
The Portland Timbers experienced a notable match against Sporting Kansas City known as "The Double Post" on October 29, 2015.
John Spencer was the head coach of Portland Timbers from December 1, 2010, to July 9, 2012.
Giovanni Savarese served as the head coach of Portland Timbers from December 18, 2017, to August 21, 2023.
Phil Neville became the head coach of Portland Timbers on November 6, 2023.
Diego Chara has been serving as the captain of Portland Timbers since 2022.
Diego Valeri was inducted into the Portland Timbers Ring of Honor on July 15, 2023.
In the 2020 MLS season, Portland Timbers finished 3rd in the regular season and won the MLS is Back Tournament.
Fanendo Adi was the top goalscorer for Portland Timbers in both the 2015 and 2016 MLS seasons, scoring 18 goals each season.
Diego Valeri scored 21 goals in the 2017 MLS season, making him the top goalscorer for Portland Timbers that year.
Portland Timbers reached the quarter-finals of the CONCACAF Champions League in 2021.
Diego Chará has made a total of 428 appearances for Portland Timbers across all competitions as of the provided information.
